techmeme.title: Bangladesh orders a nationwide shutdown of its mobile internet amid student protests that killed dozens of people to "ensure the security of citizens" (Daryna Antoniuk/The Record)
Huawei sues MediaTek in China over alleged infringement of its intellectual property patents; MediaTek says the lawsuit would have no significant impact (Nikkei Asia)
CrowdStrike says it has "widespread reports of BSODs on Windows hosts", impacting thousands of PCs and taking banks, airlines, broadcasters, and more offline (Tom Warren/The Verge)
Google cuts Maps API pricing for Indian developers by ~70% and starts accepting payments in rupee, after Ola offered one-year free developer access to Ola Maps (Shashank Pathak/Entrackr)
Messari CEO Ryan Selkis says he ran "too hot" with X posts this week calling for war and sending immigrants back, after Messari leadership told him to cool it (Nick Baker/CoinDesk)
